alert.note: Alert for Allegany (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 26 at 6:15PM EST until January 26 at 7:15PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Allegany County in western Maryland... Central Mineral County in eastern West Virginia... * Until 715 PM EST. * At 614 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located 7 miles west of Piedmont, or 7 miles west of Westernport, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes Highway 220 between Cumberland and New Creek, and Highway 50 between Junction and Skyline. Locations impacted include... Keyser, Westernport, Bel Air, Lonaconing, Piedmont, Elk Garden, Kitzmiller, Cresaptown, Potomac Park, Wiley Ford, Rawlings, Barton, Midland, Franklin, Luke, Dogwood Flats, New Creek, Mccoole, Brady and Ridgeville. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges, and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for a sudden loss of traction. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
